Here , we investigate further the events triggered by <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in response to LPS .

We show that <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> associates with the high - affinity LPS binding protein membrane <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to serve as an LPS receptor complex , and that LPS treatment enhances the oligomerization of <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Concomitant with receptor oligomerization , the IL-1R - associated kinase ( IRAK ) is recruited to the <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> complex .

Intracellular deletion variants of <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> lacking C-terminal 13 or 141 aa fail to recruit IRAK , which is consistent with the inability of these mutants to transmit LPS cellular signaling .

Moreover , both deletion mutants could still form complexes with wild-type <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and act in a dominant - negative ( DN ) fashion to block <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated signal transduction .
